decks.notes: The main idea of this combo deck is to quickly cycle through your deck by casting all your spells in one turn, milling it entirely, and then winning the game with Thassa's Oracle's ETB ability or Dread Return. The deck aims to use cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy to mill yourself and then utilize cards such as Reanimate or Memory's Journey to bring back key pieces from the graveyard. The high amount of fast mana and card selection helps to ensure the combo is executed efficiently and consistently.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell, Omniscience, and Dream Halls to cheat out big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield for free. With the help of cards like Cunning Wish and Up the Beanstalk, the deck can also search for specific answers or ramp up its mana base to cast multiple spells in a turn. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells, while also utilizing cards like Force of Will to protect its combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive Eldrazi creatures to put pressure on the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, combined with cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes cards like Wasteland and Wastescape Battlemage to control the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to be aggressively proactive, utilizing a combination of efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and powerful creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Amped Raptor to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck uses disruptive cards such as Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the board. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls adds a powerful finisher to close out games. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, removal like Swords to Plowshares, and card draw/filtering with Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also aims to generate value and advantage through Leyline binding and Leyline of the Guildpact. The win condition is to ramp up and play powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Quantum Riddler, while also having some utility creatures like Orcish Bowmasters. The mana base is diverse to support the deck's multicolor requirements.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on aggressive plays and disrupting opponents' mana bases. By utilizing powerful artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator, as well as disruptive creatures like Magus of the Moon, the deck aims to control the game tempo and overwhelm opponents with big threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The deck also includes efficient mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb, allowing for fast and explosive starts. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and disrupt opponents' plans to secure a victory.

The deck aims to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play by casting Show and Tell or Omniscience. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps to control the board and generate advantage. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo pieces. LÃ³rien Revealed and Cunning Wish provide additional flexibility and options for finding key cards. The deck is built around the idea of quickly and efficiently assembling its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Show and Tell to cheat powerful cards into play, mainly Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, supported by Omniscience for additional value. It includes a mix of card selection (Ponder, Brainstorm) and disruption (Force of Will, Daze) to control the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats while also having the potential for explosive plays using cards like Lotus Petal and Veil of Summer. The inclusion of Yggdrasil, Rebirth Engine further enhances the deck's combo potential.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana, searching through the library for key pieces, and ultimately casting a lethal Tendrils of Agony to win the game. It utilizes various forms of card draw and discard to sculpt its hand and manipulate the top of the library, while also incorporating graveyard recursion and protection spells to ensure the combo can be successfully executed. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a storm of spells and finish them off with a high storm count Tendrils of Agony for a game-winning turn.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters, Amped Raptor, and Ocelot Pride to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also relies on disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah serves as a powerful finisher and Wasteland helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to be fast and disruptive, putting pressure on the opponent from the start.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Colossal Grave-Reaver, and then bring them back into play with cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate. The deck also has ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy. The goal is to create a powerful board presence early in the game and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react. The deck relies on speed and graveyard manipulation to win the game.

This deck aims to quickly and efficiently get big creatures into play from the graveyard using various reanimation spells such as Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Dance of the Dead. The key strategy is to discard powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Worldgorger Dragon using cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy, then bring them back into play for a quick win. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Unmask to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on comboing off with reanimated creatures to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan using powerful artifacts and enchantments like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and The One Ring while ramping into big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and dragons like Pyrogoyf and Fury. With cards like Magus of the Moon and Sundering Eruption to punish nonbasic lands, this deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources and overwhelm them with efficient aggression and disruption. Additionally, cards like Lotus Petal and Chrome Mox help accelerate mana production for explosive starts.

The deck focuses on disruption and resource denial through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize, removal spells like Smallpox, and land destruction with cards like Wasteland. The goal is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Liliana of the Veil and Karn, the Great Creator to maintain pressure. It also utilizes unique cards like Urza's Saga and Eumidian Hatchery to generate additional value and advantage. The deck aims to grind out the opponent with incremental advantages and eventually overwhelm them with its control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play small, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Force of Will. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. By utilizing card selection with Preordain and Brainstorm, as well as mana denial with Wasteland, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently to secure a win in the early game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent using efficient threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, while disrupting their strategy with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to deal with opposing threats. It aims to control the tempo of the game through a combination of aggression and disruption, utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm to generate card advantage and ensure a consistent flow of threats.
